it.unibo.alchemist.model.implementations.environments

Class AbstractLinkingRuleEnvironment<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unibo.alchemist.model.implementations.environments.AbstractEnvironment<T>
      • it.unibo.alchemist.model.implementations.environments.AbstractLinkingRuleEnvironment<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEnvironment<T>, Serializable, Iterable<INode<T>>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Continuous2DEnvironment

    public abstract class AbstractLinkingRuleEnvironment<T>
extends AbstractEnvironment<T>
    An environment that links nodes according to an external rule.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • addNode

        public void addNode(INode<T> node,
                    IPosition p)
        Description copied from interface: IEnvironment
        This method allows to add a new node to this environment. The environment is responsible to call the right method of the simulation in order to ensure that the reaction is properly scheduled.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to add
        p - The position where to place it

      • computeEnvironment

        protected INeighborhood<T> computeEnvironment(INode<T> center)
        Produces a new neighborhood after a node movement operation.
        Parameters:
        center - the node to recompute
        Returns:
        the new neighborhood

        Returns:

        public INeighborhood<T> getNeighborhood(INode<T> center)
        Description copied from interface: IEnvironment
        Given a node, this method returns its neighborhood.
        Parameters:
        center - The node you want the neighbors to be found
        Returns:
        the neighborhood

        protected TIntObjectHashMap<INeighborhood<T>> getNeighborsCache()
        Returns:

      • removeNode

        public void removeNode(INode<T> node)
        Description copied from interface: IEnvironment
        This method allows to remove a node. If node removal is unsupported, it does nothing.
        Specified by:
        removeNode in interface IEnvironment<T>
        Overrides:
        removeNode in class AbstractEnvironment<T>
        Parameters:
        node - the node to remove

      • setLinkingRule

        public void setLinkingRule(ILinkingRule<T> r)
        Parameters:

      • updateNeighborhood

        protected void updateNeighborhood(INode<T> node)
        After a node movement, recomputes the neighborhood, also notifying the running simulation about the modifications. This allows movement actions to be defined as LOCAL (they should be normally considered GLOBAL).
        Parameters:
        node - the node that has been moved

      • updateNeighbors

        protected void updateNeighbors(INeighborhood<T> neigh)
        Scans the neighborhood, and for each neighbor ensures that the link is bidirectional.
        Parameters:
        neigh - the neighborhood to scan
